org.inf.nepalicalendar

Class NepaliCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.inf.nepalicalendar.NepaliCalendar

  • public class NepaliCalendar
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class Calendar. does all the calculation we need with the nepali dates

    • Field Detail

      • NEPALI_CALENDAR_DATA

        public static final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> NEPALI_CALENDAR_DATA
        contains all data that we need convert the dates.
        for every year we need 13 values:
        • 1: the day in Paush (9th. nepali month) that is equal to the first January in this year
        • 2-13: amount of days in month beginning with Baisakh and ending with Chaitra
        HashMap<nepali year , List<day in Paush for 1st Jan, no of days in Baisakh, no of days in Jestha, no of days in Ashadh, ...>>
        example:
        put((2068), Arrays.asList(17, 31, 31, 32, 32, 31, 30, 30, 29, 30, 29, 30, 30));

      • possibleFiscalYears

        private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,FiscalYear> possibleFiscalYears
        The possible types of fiscal years.

    • Method Detail

      • convertGregorianToNepaliDate

        public final NepaliDate convertGregorianToNepaliDate(java.util.Date gregorianDate)
                                              throws NepaliDateException
        Convert english to nepali date. The idea for converting bases on this pages:
        • Algorithm to convert English date to Nepali date using C# .NET
        • Biren & J2EE in Java Blogs - Nepali Calendar in java
        Parameters:
        gregorianDate - the english date
        Returns:
        a valid nepali date object
        Throws:
        NepaliDateException

      • convertNepaliToGregorianDate

        Parameters:

        Returns:

                                java.lang.String fiscalYearType)
                                        throws NepaliDateException
        Gets the start fiscal year.
        Parameters:
        nepaliYearNumberPart1 - the year of the start of the fiscal year. So "2067" of "2067/2068"
        fiscalYearType - the fiscal year type
        Returns:
        Date object of the first day in the fiscal year
        Throws:
        NepaliDateException
